t: Amazon's Fire Phone Introduces Firefly, A Feature That Lets You Identify (And Buy!) Things You See In The Real World | TechCrunch
s: June 18, 2014 - With the debut of the Amazon Fire Phone this afternoon, the company introduced a new feature called Firefly, which is largely designed to let you identify -- and then, of course, buy -- things you see out in the real world. Firefly takes advantage of the smartphone's camera to let you identify ...

If you have a Fire tablet that supports Firefly, you can launch Firefly by swiping down from the top of the screen and then tapping the Firefly icon in the Quick Settings menu, by tapping the Firefly icon in the carousel, or by tapping Apps, then the Firefly icon.
